column4: guys I have this error message when I try to start apache 2, http://askubuntu.com/questions/203844/apache-doesnt-start-after-upgrade-to-12-10, is the first time I see it, can you help me please?=
did you read what you posted?
why are you involving cron if your issue is with apache?
sudo service apache2 start
well if you want to use apache2, you should install it
so you have apache2 running now?
really I dont know, I had some error trying to install, and removing, Im trying with autoremove (that was in the message)
you should pastebin what you are doing and the full output
okok, I'll paste, its very strange
ok, use a pastebin like http://paste.ubuntu.com for example
as you can see, look that its installed fine, but later, when I try to run apache2 doesnt find httpd.conf
do you have /etc/apache2/httpd.conf ?
yes, right now I made a locate, is in /etc/apache2/conf.d/httpd.conf
so that's "no".  Umm, do you have configuration that you want to keep or is it ok to purge your apache configuration?
Im going to purge it
tell me the result of this command: grep httpd.conf /var/lib/dpkg/info/apache2*
https://gist.github.com/3925306#comments
sudo apt-get purge apache2.2-common
done. Now I reinstall?
now: sudo apt-get install apache2
running, buff...............really I didnt know how to solf this situation, thanks a lot jrib

it was because you kept your old apache2.conf.  The old one expected a /etc/apache2/httpd.conf but the new packaging deleted /etc/apache2/httpd.conf and moved it to /etc/apache2/conf.d/httpd.conf (I think)
